result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarrod A. Lamberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Abuse Hazardous Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.316(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by PO. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jarrod A. Lamberg

14CM814>>5 months MCJ, w/credit for 76 days of time already served w/huber for the following: work, school, treatment, community service, child care, AA meetings and Living Free meetings (all to be reflected on JOC), all ONLY if defendant qualifies under jail classification system; CC if any are outstanding.

15CM557>>Sentence W/held; 1 year probation
CONDITIONS: Absolute sobriety;Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; CC.
>>no credit in the event of revocation
